title: U.S. News: Gates Charity Aims At Gender Equality
text:
Amounting to the equivalent of about $420 million a year, the funding is intended to help women get training and financial services, to increase access to contraceptives and to help elevate women into leadership roles in health, law and economics.

Ms. French Gates has set an agenda distinct from that of her husband, Microsoft Corp. co-founder Bill Gates, from whom she filed for divorce in May. For Mr. Gates, eradicating polio and facilitating biomedical breakthroughs such as vaccines are priorities for the foundation.

The announcement comes as the philanthropy's leadership weighs changes to its governance and shortly after longtime trustee Warren Buffett stepped down.

Ms. French Gates has made women and families the focus of her work in recent years as co-chair of the foundation and at her own company, Pivotal Ventures.

Ms. French Gates in 2019 announced a 10-year, $1 billion investment in gender equality through Pivotal Ventures.

"The world has been fighting for gender equality for decades, but progress has been slow," she said ahead of a speech she was scheduled to deliver on Wednesday in Paris.
